comment: "Editor killed article after learning I was not a porn star using a pen name (no idea where she got an idea this absolutely insane), offering a kill fee. I told her if she wanted a kill fee option, she should have noted that in a contract upfront and the full amount was due. (Seriously? A porn star?!?!) She then proceeded to simply ignore my emails requesting payment, so I threatened to turn Cosmo into NYC Freelance Isn't Free. Eventually got an email from her boss saying a contract I signed maybe 2 years ago for Marie Claire (yes, an entirely different magazine) included a kill fee option, so legally they didn't have to pay. She then offered -- out of the goodness of her heart -- to pay in full. She did not offer any insight as to why this exceptionally young editor thought I had a shadow career in porn. Took more than a month and one more reminder to the editor's boss for payment to arrive."

relationship: Referral (you had a connection who connected you to the editor)

comment: "This is payment for a full season of review coverage that is outstanding."
paidYet: Haven't gotten it yet (as of this reporting)
relationship: Ongoing/pre-existing relationship with editor or publication

comment: "Heavily edited, to the point where the service-y piece became less helpful overall. First round of edits were great, but senior editorial rewrote parts to the point of introducing falsities into the piece. Had to guide each draft closely, all the way up to the final."

"Getting paid was a hassle because I'm outside the US and they only pay via direct deposit, but my editor was very diligent about keeping in touch and sorting things out for me. I don't anticipate any more issues going forward."

relationship: Solicited pitch (editor asked you to pitch)
